label: Optimal (Hash Map)
approach: Instead of checking every pair, use a hash map to remember numbers we've seen. For each number, compute the complement (target − current) and check if it's already in the map.
steps: Create an empty hash map to store {value → index}.
Iterate through the array. For each number, compute complement = target − nums[i].
If the complement exists in the map, return [map[complement], i].
Otherwise, store nums[i] → i in the map and continue.

label: Brute Force
approach: Check every possible pair of numbers using two nested loops. Simple to understand but slow for large inputs.
steps: For each element at index i, loop through every element at index j > i.
If nums[i] + nums[j] equals the target, return [i, j].
This checks n×(n−1)/2 pairs in the worst case.
